intro: Stylocoryna polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited stylocoryna, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Stylocoryna polycarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
